entries.english: Mbogo (buffalo), Huria/Munyi (rhinoceros), Methūka vs Enyūka (crack small vs large), Mīago (leisure), Ikeno (happiness), Mūcang'ang'a (gossip), Mūthīgi (elder's staff), Rūthanju (herding stick), Mūtino (accident-unpredictable), Ūgwati (extreme danger-predictable)

Kũheane (give away), Gũtanaha (give generously/selflessly), Kũhĩnja/Kũmoca (be thin/lose weight), Kũhana mũnyuko (extremely thin/skeletal), Kwĩhotora/Kwĩharĩria (prepare for action), Makore (husks), Muura (maize pollen/sawdust), Mbaco/Mbogoro (bow legs), Mbegũ (seeds), Mbeũ (selected seeds/youth)

Gwĩthirima (spread oil with palms), Kwĩhaka (apply substance with tool), Heho (cold weather), Mbaa (extremely cold with fog), Kĩbii (mist/fog), Kĩnundu (fog), Kũgwata (grasp with both hands/rape/kidnap), Kũnyita (grasp one or both hands), Kũhahũra (scare/shock), Kũmakia (frighten)

Bacania (drop noisily), Gũithania (drop carelessly), Gĩthayo/Kīgūūta (lazy person), Gocogoco (unnecessary verbal trouble), Ngarari (arguments), Gũkunga (bend to avoid), Gũcema (bend to hide), Gũtherema (spread/increase area), Kũingĩha (increase), Gũthetha (wish ill verbally), Kũroga (cause harm via poison/witchcraft), Gũtirūka (lose footing), Kũhĩngwo (trip on object), Gũtuma (sew), Kũrata (mend/patch)
Complete list of interchangeable words showing dialectal variations and synonyms
